title: Sicilian Iced Coffee

ingredients.content: 200 g strong brewed espresso coffee, cooled

preparations.content: Place coconut sugar in mixing bowl and grind <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add 350 g of the ice and blend <b>20 sec/speed 9<b>, with aid of spatula.

Add remaining ice and espresso coffee then blend <b>1 min/speed 9<b>, with aid of spatula. Transfer to a freezable bowl or container and set aside in freezer for approx. 4 hours. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Towards end of freezing time, <b>insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place cream in mixing bowl and whip <b>until soft peaks form/speed 3.5<b>.
Divide iced coffee into 6 serving bowls or glasses and top with whipped cream and coffee beans (optional).

hintsAndTricks: The whipping time in step 4 will depend on how fresh your cream is. The fresher the cream, the longer it will take to form soft peaks. Watch your cream carefully through the hole in mixing bowl lid to ensure you don't overwhip it.
